top_categories.workout_context: Giro Sardegna Gravel's Sardinian mountains gravel (75%), Paved roads (25%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 81 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Giro Sardegna Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
105ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At mile 60 of 81, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
At Giro Sardegna Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
8,530ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Giro Sardegna Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Giro Sardegna Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
8,530ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on sardinian mountains—rolling terrain with coastal. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 8,530ft of climbing on sardinian mountains—rolling terrain with coastal does to your power file on race day.
Low-cadence force work for 8,530ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Giro Sardegna Gravel’s 81 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Giro Sardegna Gravel demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride sardinian mountains—rolling terrain with coastal views at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: sardinian mountains gravel (75%), paved roads (25%), rolling terrain. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 81 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 81 miles of sardinian mountains—rolling terrain with coastal views in Siniscola, Sardinia, Italy.
